Keywords: Age of Apocalypse , Brotherhood of Mutants , Excalibur , Future , Horsemen , Past , Scientist , X-Men
Real Name: Moira Kinross
Special Powers
STARTING PLOT POINTS: 0
CONTINUITY: When Mother is KO'd, an opponent chooses a character (friendly or opposing). That opponent places the chosen character in its starting area, then either deals them 1 unavoidable damage or heals them 1 click.
(+1) THE FIRST DEATH OF MOIRA X: FREE: Until your next turn, Mother may use her displayed damage power twice per turn.
(-3) THE FIFTH DEATH OF MOIRA X: FREE: Choose a standard character with the X-Men keyword within 6 squares and line of fire and modify its combat values +1 until your next turn. Mother's KO effect gains "This game, friendly standard characters with the X-Men keyword can use Perplex this game." After resolutions, give Mother 2 Plot Points.
(-5) THE NINTH DEATH OF MOIRA X: FREE: Until your next turn, you may reroll each attack roll once (in addition to other rerolls). Mother's KO effect gains "This game, friendly standard characters with the X-Men keyword can use Probability Control."

April 29, 2021
muel0017
[QUOTE=quicklink;12130496]Question: When she uses TK on her first two clicks, is that an attack, so she dont get 1 damage? So she would at least have a range of 6.[/QUOTE] Title characters only take the 1 damage if you use a plot ability without making an attack, so if you use her TK to place your own people that would not trigger the 1 damage Title character effect. However if you did activated plot abilities and then only use TK to place your people, then you would take damage.

It looks like she is almost meant to ko herself. After using all of her title abilities, the benefits of her being ko'd definitely outweigh the mild downside. Overall great support and possibly my favorite title character since Odinson.

HectorXV
Such a great support piece for the points on X-Men themed teams. Could be played on Scientist themed teams too. However, being a Title Character, it'll be hard to keep this piece alive. This piece isn't meant to be in battle to make attacks to use it's plot points, especially with a 0 range. But, I guess there has to be some balance?
